g.text: pressure field of plane waves is used, and periodic boundary conditions are imposed to the upper and lower
boundaries to simplify the structure and reduce the amount of calculation without losing accuracy. Each strip of
is independently calculated. Perfectly matched layers (PMLs) are also used in
to eliminate the reflected waves by the outer boundaries.
The structures consist of the loss and gain medium with a positive and neg-
ative imaginary part respectively. Generally, the acoustic loss materials are ubiquitous in nature because acoustic
loss can be easily caused by viscous elasticity. It should be noted that a natural acoustic gain media has not yet
been found. However, it can be effectively realized by well-designed feedback systems
proposed structures can be realized by using the sensors and pre-amplifiers. The sensed signal is amplified in a
pre-amplifier of appropriate gain progression. In addition, an equivalent acoustic gain system can be constructed
by combining auxiliary devices such as microphones and loudspeakers.
